abstract: Chicago Teachers Union votes 88 percent in favor of strike after union negotiators and school officials are unable to resolve differences over evaluations, salaries, pension contributions and standardized testing; vote of group that numbers almost 27,000 employees may lead to union's second walkout in four years and delivers another pressing political challenge for Mayor Rahm Emanuel.
lead_paragraph: The vote clears the way for the second walkout in four years, with negotiations thus far failing to resolve differences over money, evaluations and testing.

headline.main: Chicago Teachers Approve Call to Strike as Contract Talks Stall
headline.print_headline: Teachers in Chicago Approve Call for Strike

snippet: The vote clears the way for the second walkout in four years, with negotiations thus far failing to resolve differences over money, evaluations and testing.
